abstract.text: This protocol defines a platform-agnostic api that’s shared
by the UIKit and AppKit
components.

inlineContent.text: By implementing and using this protocol in the library, the
library doesn’t have to do a bunch of
This protocol aggregates many other protocols, although the
protocols often implement each other. To show all protocols,
some are commented out in the list below.

abstract.text: RichTextKit is a Swift-based library that lets you work with rich text in UIKit, AppKit and SwiftUI.
The text view’s frame.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
a writable rich text string.
Paste images into the text view, at a certain index.
Scroll to a certain range.
Get the attachment size for a certain image.
This protocol defines a platform-agnostic api that’s shared
by the UIKit and AppKit
components.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
rich text attribute reading capabilities.
Alert a certain title and message.
Use the selected range (if any) or text position to get
all rich text attribute values.
Use the selected range (if any) or text position to set
the current font size.
Paste an image into the text view, at a certain index.
Use the selected range (if any) or text position to set
the current font.
Get the attachment bounds for a certain image.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
rich text color reading capabilities.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
a rich text string.
Use the selected range (if any) or text position to set
the current font name.
This is a platform-agnostic rich text view that can be used
in both UIKit and AppKit.
Use the selected range (if any) or text position to set
the current value for a certain rich text style.
Whether or not the text view is the first responder.

view, as well as other editor-specific properties.
